p: The consequences of excessive Ang II include pulmonary vasoconstriction, inflammatory, and cytokine-induced organ damage [ 47] secondary to increased membrane permeability [ 48], and increased epithelial cell apoptosis [ 49]. The effects are predominantly mediated through the unopposed AT 1 receptor activation secondary to decreased ACE2 levels [ 50]. Furthermore, the pro-inflammatory cascade [ 51] and increased vascular permeability [ 48] caused by over-activation of the AT 1 receptor in the lungs directly induce acute lung injury (ALI), acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), and lead to death [ 10, 33].
